title: Is Winning the Best New Artist Grammy Award a Curse? A Look at What Happened to the Past 11 Winners
body_text:
Winning the Best New Artist Grammy Award is considered a prestigious honor for any musician. However, the past 11 winners have faced a string of unfortunate events, leading some to question whether winning the award is a curse.

The most recent winner, Dua Lipa, has faced criticism for her decision to collaborate with the controversial producer, Max Martin, who has been accused of exploitation and mistreating artists. Lipa has also faced backlash for her decision to wear a controversial outfit during her acceptance speech.

Previous winners have also faced criticism and controversy. Cardi B, who won the award in 2018, faced backlash for her use of a derogatory term in her acceptance speech. She has also faced criticism for her divisive lyrics and public feuds with other artists.

Adele, who won the award in 2012, faced criticism for her decision to cancel several concerts due to vocal cord issues. She has also faced controversy for her decision to wear a revealing outfit during her acceptance speech.

The curse of winning the Best New Artist Grammy Award has led some artists to question whether the award is worth the negative attention and backlash. However, others argue that the award can provide exposure and help launch a career.

Despite the negative attention, the Best New Artist Grammy Award remains a prestigious honor and is highly coveted by musicians. Only time will tell if the curse of winning the award is real or just a myth.

title: ‘Lucifer’ Revived at Netflix After Fox Cancellation

title: Yolanda Hadid Reveals She Contemplated Suicide While Battling Lyme Disease

She says, "I couldn't walk. I couldn't do anything. I was in constant pain. I was depressed. I felt hopeless."

Despite her struggles, Yolanda refused to give up and sought out help from doctors and therapists. She also turned to her faith for comfort and support.

She eventually began to feel better and was able to resume some of her previous activities. However, the illness continued to affect her, and she ultimately passed away in 2015.

Yolanda's struggles with Lyme disease serve as a reminder of the challenges that people with chronic illnesses face every day. Her story is a powerful testament to the resilience of the human spirit and the importance of seeking help and support when needed.

In honor of Yolanda's life and legacy, we must continue to raise awareness about Lyme disease and the need for better treatment and care. Rest in peace, Yolanda Hadid.

title: Sara Gilbert: ‘I Do Stand Behind’ ‘Roseanne’ Cancellation

Sara Gilbert, one of the stars of the hit ABC sitcom "Roseanne," has spoken out about the cancellation of the show. In an interview with Entertainment Tonight, Gilbert said that she supports the decision to cancel the show, which was abruptly axed earlier this month after star Roseanne Barr made a controversial tweet about former President Barack Obama's advisor Valerie Jarrett.

"I do stand behind the decision to cancel the show," Gilbert said. "I think it's important to have consequences for your actions, and I think it's important to have a safe space for all of us to be able to continue to tell our stories and be ourselves."

Gilbert, who played the character of Darlene on "Roseanne," added that she believes the show's cancellation will not have a negative impact on the careers of the other cast members.

"I think it's important to take a step back and reflect on what's important," she said. "I think we all have to take responsibility for the things that we say and the things that we do, and I think it's important to be mindful of how our actions affect other people."

Gilbert's statement is in line with the stance of ABC, which announced earlier this month that it was canceling "Roseanne" due to Barr's tweet. The network said that it did not want to "encourage or enable" any behavior that could be offensive to any group of people.

"ABC does not tolerate language that is offensive to any individual or group," the network said in a statement. "The language used on the show last week is not acceptable and does not align with our values."

Despite the cancellation, Gilbert said that she hopes to continue working with the rest of the cast on future projects.

"I hope that we can continue to tell our stories together," she said. "I think it's important to continue to have representation on screen and continue to tell our stories and continue to be ourselves."

title: Grammy Awards 2018: Jay-Z misses out as Bruno Mars wins big

Jay-Z, who was nominated for several awards, including Album of the Year and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration, was not among the winners. Despite this, he still received two Grammy Awards for Best Rap Performance for "4:44" and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration for "The Story of O.J."

title: Forever Love: Inside Country Music's Best Love Stories

From the classic love songs of the past to the modern hits of today, country music has a long history of capturing the essence of love in a way that resonates with audiences of all ages.

One of the most enduring themes in country music is the idea of forever love. Whether it's the unbreakable bond between two lovers who have been together for decades, or the love that is meant to last a lifetime, the concept of forever love is a central part of the genre.

One of the most famous love stories in country music is that of George Strait and Trisha Yearwood. The two have been together for over 30 years and have recorded several albums together, including the iconic "Write Me a Love Song." Strait and Yearwood's love story is a testament to the power of true love and the idea that it can last a lifetime.

Another example of a country music love story is that of Tim McGraw and Faith Hill. The two have been together for over 20 years and have recorded several albums together, including the multi-platinum selling "Up Close and Personal." McGraw and Hill's love story is a testament to the power of love to overcome any obstacle and to last a lifetime.

Country music is full of love stories, from the classic love songs of the past to the modern hits of today. From the love that lasts a lifetime to the love that is meant to be forever, country music has a way of capturing the essence of love in a way that is both heartfelt and inspiring.

title: 'Thoroughbreds' and the Enduring Allure of the Bad Friend

The world of thoroughbred horse racing is a world of passion and allure. From the majestic thoroughbreds themselves to the thrill of the races, there is something about the sport that captures the imagination and hearts of many. But what makes thoroughbreds so special, and why do they continue to be beloved by those who follow the sport?

One reason for the enduring allure of thoroughbreds is their versatility. They can be raced for speed, endurance, and even for fun. Whether they're competing on the track or being used for other purposes, thoroughbreds are always in high demand.

Another reason for their appeal is their grace and beauty. Thoroughbreds are known for their flowing manes and tails, and their sleek, muscular bodies. Their beauty is a source of inspiration and awe for many, and they are often considered to be the epitome of elegance and sophistication.

Despite their many charms, thoroughbreds are not without their flaws. They can be temperamental and difficult to train, and they can be prone to injuries and illnesses. But despite these challenges, many people continue to fall in love with thoroughbreds and to pursue them as a hobby or a career.

For many, the allure of thoroughbreds is rooted in their ability to inspire and to bring people together. Whether they're watching a race from the stands or training a horse themselves, people who are involved with thoroughbreds often feel a sense of connection and community.

In conclusion, the enduring allure of thoroughbreds is a testament to their versatility, beauty, and the special bond that they can form with those who care for them. Despite their many challenges, thoroughbreds continue to capture the hearts of those who follow the sport, and they will continue to be loved and admired for generations to come.

title: How to Do a Messy Bun: Messy Bun Tutorial
body_text:
Here is a messy bun tutorial for those who want to achieve the popular hairstyle:

1. Start by brushing your hair to remove any tangles or knots.
2. Separate your hair into three sections: top, middle, and bottom.
3. Take the top section of hair and pull it back, away from your face. Secure it with a hair tie or clip.
4. Take the middle section of hair and pull it forward, away from your face. Secure it with another hair tie or clip.
5. Take the bottom section of hair and pull it back, away from your face. Secure it with a third hair tie or clip.
6. Flip your head over so that the sections of hair are facing down.
7. Take the top section of hair and wrap it around the middle section, securing it with bobby pins or a hair tie.
8. Take the middle section of hair and wrap it around the bottom section, securing it with bobby pins or a hair tie.
9. Take the bottom section of hair and wrap it around the top section, securing it with bobby pins or a hair tie.
10. Flip your head back over so that the hair is facing forward.
11. Use your fingers to loosen the bun and give it a messy, asymmetrical look.
12. Finish off the look with a spritz of hair spray.

And there you have it! A messy bun tutorial that is easy to follow and achievable for anyone. Whether you're heading to a casual day out or a special occasion, a messy bun is a versatile and stylish hairstyle that is sure to make you look and feel great.

title: Sam Shepard, Pulitzer-winning playwright, is dead at 73
body_text:
Sam Shepard, the Pulitzer-winning playwright and actor, has passed away at the age of 73. He was a highly acclaimed and influential figure in the American theater, known for his innovative and experimental works that explored the human condition and the boundaries of reality.

Shepard was born in Fort Bragg, California, in 1947 and began his career as an actor in the 1970s. He quickly transitioned to writing, and his plays were produced Off-Broadway and on Broadway, as well as in numerous regional theaters and international venues.

Some of his most famous works include "A Lie of the Mind," " Fool for Love," and "True West." He won the Pulitzer Prize for Drama in 1979 for his play "Hurlyburly," which was later adapted into a film by David Lynch.

Shepard was also an accomplished actor, appearing in numerous films, including "The Right Stuff," "The Tree of Life," and "The Wild Bunch." He was also a member of the Actors Studio, a prestigious New York City theater company.

Shepard was known for his distinctive style, which blended elements of absurdism, existentialism, and the American Southwest. He was also known for his unconventional approach to staging, often using non-traditional settings and experimental lighting and sound effects.

Shepard was a beloved figure in the theater world, and his death has been met with widespread sadness and condolences from colleagues and admirers alike. He leaves behind a legacy of innovative and thought-provoking plays that continue to inspire and challenge audiences to this day.

title: Brigitte Bardot: Most actresses' harassment claims are 'hypocritical and ridiculous'
body_text:
"Brigitte Bardot, the iconic French actress and animal rights activist, has lashed out at actresses who have recently come forward with allegations of sexual harassment, calling their claims 'hypocritical and ridiculous'.

In a statement to the press, Bardot said, 'These actresses who are making allegations against famous men are just looking for attention. They are hypocrites who have done worse in the past and now they want to pretend they are innocent'.

Bardot, who has been an outspoken advocate for animal rights for decades, added, 'These women are only concerned with themselves and their careers. They have no respect for the men they are accusing and are just using them as a way to get attention'.

Bardot's comments have sparked controversy and criticism from those who support the actresses who have come forward with their allegations. Many argue that it is never too late for victims to come forward and that silence on the issue only perpetuates a culture of abuse.

Despite the backlash, Bardot remains steadfast in her stance, stating that 'these allegations are baseless and false'. She added, 'These women are just using the harassment allegations as a way to get attention and advance their careers'.

Bardot's comments come at a time when the #MeToo movement has been gaining momentum, with actresses such as Harvey Weinstein and Kevin Spacey facing numerous allegations of sexual harassment and assault. The movement has sparked a much-needed conversation about the prevalence of sexual harassment and assault in Hollywood and beyond, and has led to numerous men being held accountable for their actions.

Bardot's comments, while controversial, serve as a reminder that not everyone views the issue of sexual harassment in the same way. Some argue that the allegations are overblown and that the movement is being used as a way for actresses to advance their careers. Only time will tell if Bardot's comments will be seen as a bold and prescient statement or as a regressive and dangerous one."

title: William H. Macy backstage at the SAG Awards: 'It's hard to be a man these days'
body_text:
William H. Macy, a well-known actor and producer, recently backstage at the SAG Awards, shared his thoughts on the challenges that men face in today's society. 

"It's hard to be a man these days," Macy said, reflecting on the current climate. "There's a lot of pressure on men to be strong and powerful, but also to be sensitive and emotional. It's a difficult balance to strike."

Macy, who has starred in numerous films and TV shows, including "Fargo" and "Shameless," emphasized the importance of male role models in society.

title: 2018 ACM Awards list of winners
body_text:
The 2018 ACM Awards ceremony took place on June 21, honoring the best in computing. The winners of this year's ceremony are as follows:

* Best Technical Achievement Award: Google's TensorFlow, a powerful open-source platform for building and deploying machine learning models.
* Best Product of the Year Award: Amazon's Alexa, the voice-activated助手 that has become a popular choice for consumers.
* Best Paper Award: "A Survey of Deep Learning," a comprehensive review of the latest developments in the field.
* Best Student Research Award: "Scaling Up Deep Learning with TensorFlow," a study on how to improve the efficiency of deep learning models.
* Best Educator Award: Dr. Anca Pǎunescu, a computer science professor at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, for her contributions to teaching and mentoring students in the field.
* Best Industry Award: Apple, for its innovative products and services, including the iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch.

The ACM Awards are presented annually by the Association for Computing Machinery to recognize outstanding contributions to the field of computing. The winners were chosen by a committee of experts in the field and were announced at a ceremony in San Francisco.

title: Gabrielle Union on how she uses therapy and a vision board to overcome feelings of worthlessness
body_text:
Gabrielle Union, a star of the hit TV show "America's Got Talent," recently opened up about her struggles with feelings of worthlessness. In an interview with Oprah Winfrey, Union revealed that she has used therapy and a vision board as tools to overcome these feelings.

"I've struggled with feeling like I'm not good enough," Union explained. "I've always been hard on myself, and I think that's something that's been passed down to me from my parents. But I've learned that therapy and creating a vision board have been really helpful for me."

The vision board, which Union creates by collecting images and phrases that resonate with her, serves as a constant reminder of her worth and goals. "It's a visual representation of my desires and aspirations," she said. "It's something that I can look at whenever I'm feeling doubt or uncertainty."

In addition to therapy and her vision board, Union also credits her supportive husband, Dwyane Wade, with helping her to overcome her feelings of worthlessness. "He's always been there for me, and he's helped me to see that I'm valuable and worthy of love and respect," she said.

Overall, Union's story is a reminder that it's okay to struggle with feelings of worthlessness, and that there are many resources available to help individuals overcome these feelings.

title: Aly Raisman Calls Out U.S. Olympic Committee for “Shameless” Statement
body_text:
Aly Raisman, a former Olympic gymnast, has called out the U.S. Olympic Committee for a "shameless" statement regarding the investigation into sexual abuse allegations against team doctor Larry Nassar.

Raisman, who won two gold medals and two bronze medals at the 2012 London Olympics, said in a statement that the committee's statement was "absurd" and "disappointing." She added that the statement was "not enough to acknowledge the systemic failure and the survivors who have suffered."

The U.S. Olympic Committee released a statement on Monday regarding the investigation into Nassar, who was convicted of sexual abuse in 2017. The committee apologized to "anyone who was affected by his abuse," but also defended its handling of the situation.

Raisman, who has been an advocate for survivors of sexual abuse, said that the committee's statement was "shocking" and "insulting." She added that the statement "failed to acknowledge the survivors who have been brave enough to come forward and share their stories."

Raisman's comments come just days after a report by the Indianapolis Star revealed that Nassar had been allowed to continue working with Olympic athletes even after his first conviction. The report also revealed that the U.S. Olympic Committee had known about the abuse allegations against Nassar for years, but had failed to take action.

The report has sparked outrage and calls for the U.S. Olympic Committee to resign. Raisman's comments add to the growing pressure on the committee to take responsibility for its handling of the situation.

title: YouTube Drops Logan Paul From Google Preferred Ad Platform After 'Suicide Forest' Video
body_text:
YouTube has dropped Logan Paul from its Google Preferred ad platform following controversy over a video he posted about a "suicide forest" in Japan. The video, which has been widely criticized for its insensitivity and lack of context, was uploaded to Paul's channel in July. In the video, Paul and his friends visit a forest in Japan where several people have taken their own lives, and he jokingly films himself pretending to shoot himself in the head.

The move to drop Paul from the ad platform was announced by YouTube on Monday, saying that it had violated its policies against promoting content that glorifies or encourages suicide, self-harm, or dangerous behavior. The company also said that it had removed the video from its platform and terminated its partnership with Paul.

Paul, who is a popular vlogger with over 2 million subscribers, has faced criticism for his past videos, including one in which he pointed a gun at his head and another in which he simulated drowning. He has apologized for the mistakes in the past, but his latest controversy has once again put him in the spotlight.

The decision to drop Paul from the ad platform comes after a backlash from mental health advocates and others who criticized the video and called for YouTube to take action. The move is seen as a victory for those who have long called for stricter guidelines and enforcement of YouTube's policies, but it also highlights the challenges that social media platforms face in balancing free speech and responsibility.

Paul has yet to respond to the news, but he is expected to address the situation in a video he plans to upload later this week.

In conclusion, YouTube has dropped Logan Paul from its Google Preferred ad platform after controversy over a video he posted about a "suicide forest" in Japan. The move comes after a backlash from mental health advocates and others who criticized the video and called for YouTube to take action. title: Best & Worst New Shows: The TVLine Staff Shares Its Picks... and Passes
body_text:
Best & Worst New Shows: The TVLine Staff Shares Its Picks... and Passes

The new TV season is here, and with it comes a wealth of new shows to watch and fall in love with. From comedies to dramas, there's something for everyone to enjoy. But with so many options, it can be tough to decide which shows to watch and which to pass on. That's why we at TVLine have rounded up our staff's picks for the best and worst new shows of the season.

When it comes to the best new shows, there are a few that stand out. For those who enjoy a good medical drama, The Good Doctor is a must-watch. The show stars Freddie Highmore as a surgical resident with autism who goes above and beyond to help his patients. Another show that is receiving rave reviews is The Mandalorian. Set after the events of the Star Wars: The Force Awakens, the show follows a bounty hunter and his newfound baby on a mission to protect the galaxy.

For those who prefer their TV with a bit more humor, there are also some great options. The Conners is a spin-off of the classic sitcom Roseanne, and it's everything fans of the show could have hoped for. The show follows the Conners, a dysfunctional family, as they navigate the challenges of modern life. Another show that is worth checking out is Doom Patrol. The show is a comedic take on the DC Comics superhero team, and it features a cast of unique and quirky characters.

On the other hand, there are also a few new shows that are not worth your time. The first is The Republic of Sarah. The show follows a woman who becomes the leader of a group of survivors in a post-apocalyptic world. While the premise is interesting, the show is poorly written and acted, making it a pass. Another show that should be avoided is The Exorcist. The show is a prequel to the classic horror film, but it fails to live up to the original's legacy. The show is slow-paced and lacks any real scares or excitement.

Overall, the new TV season is shaping up to be a great one. With a mix of returning favorites and new shows to fall in love with, there's something for everyone to enjoy. Just be sure to check out our staff's picks for the best and worst new shows before making your decision on what to watch.

title: YouTube Star Kian Lawley Fired From Fox’s ‘The Hate U Give’ After Racist Video Resurfaces

title: How to Clean a Beauty Blender: 3 Easy Ways
body_text:
"Are you tired of your beauty blender looking dirty and dull? Fear not, we have the solution for you! Cleaning your beauty blender can be a daunting task, but it's essential to keep your makeup brushes and sponges in top condition. Here are three easy ways to clean your beauty blender:

1. Soak your blender in a mixture of water and mild dish soap. Soak for at least 24 hours, swirling the blender occasionally to ensure all surfaces are coated.
2. Use a soft-bristled brush to gently brush away any debris on the blender. Rinse the blender with warm water and dry it with a soft towel.
3. For a deep clean, place the blender in the microwave and heat on low for 30 seconds. Remove and let it cool before using it again.

By following these simple steps, you can keep your beauty blender in great condition and ensure a flawless makeup application every time. Happy cleaning!"

title: 20 years of Starbucks holiday cups

Starbucks has been a beloved holiday tradition for many customers since the company introduced their festive red cups in 1995. Over the years, the cups have become an iconic symbol of the holiday season and have been a source of joy and excitement for millions of customers.

The original red cups were designed by a San Francisco artist named Jim Wiens and featured a simple design with a bold, red color and the words "Merry Christmas" written in white. The cups quickly became popular and were soon being sold in stores across the United States.

In 2005, Starbucks introduced a new design for their holiday cups, featuring a more intricate design with a snowflake pattern and the words "Season's greetings" written in white. This design quickly became popular and has been used every year since.

title: What Happens if Prince Philip Outlives Queen Elizabeth II?
body_text:
Prince Philip, Queen Elizabeth II's husband, has always been a devoted and supportive partner in her reign as monarch. But what would happen if Prince Philip were to outlive Queen Elizabeth II?

At 99 years old, Prince Philip is the oldest member of the British royal family, and he has been by Queen Elizabeth II's side through numerous political and personal challenges over the years. If he were to pass away before the Queen, it would be a significant loss for her and the British people.

The Queen's reign, which began in 1952, would come to an end, and she would no longer be the longest-reigning monarch in British history. She would also be the first British monarch to lose her husband while on the throne.

title: Ashley Judd Breaks Down In Tears During First TV Interview Since Weinstein Allegations
body_text:
In a emotional and powerful interview, actress Ashley Judd broke down in tears as she discussed her experience with Harvey Weinstein and the systemic issues within the entertainment industry.

"I've had my body violated by people who I thought were supposed to protect me," Judd said, her voice shaking with emotion. "And that's not a small thing. That's a huge thing. And it's not just about me. It's about all of us."

Judd, who has been a vocal advocate for the #MeToo movement, detailed the ways in which Weinstein and others in Hollywood had used their power and influence to silence and mistreat women for decades.

"It's a systemic problem," she said. "And it's not going to be solved by a hashtag. It's not going to be solved by a movement. It's going to be solved by a fundamental change in the way that we do business."

Judd also encouraged other women who have been victims of sexual assault and harassment to come forward and speak out, saying that it was only by sharing their stories that change could be brought about.

"You have the power to break the story," she said. "You have the power to change the world. You have the power to start a movement. And you have the power to heal."

The interview was Judd's first public appearance since allegations of sexual misconduct against Weinstein first surfaced in early 2018. In the months since, Weinstein has been fired from his position at the Weinstein Company and faces numerous legal charges.

Judd's interview was broadcast on the Today show, and it quickly became a viral sensation, with viewers praising her for her courage and conviction.

"Thank you, Ashley Judd," one viewer wrote on Twitter. "Your bravery and strength are inspiring. You have the power to change the world, and you're doing just that."

Others echoed these sentiments, with many noting that Judd's interview was a powerful reminder of the ongoing struggle for gender equality and justice in the entertainment industry.

title: Martha's Best Halloween Costumes Through the Years

Halloween is one of the most exciting times of the year, and no one knows a thing or two about creating the perfect costume. One of Martha's earliest Halloween costumes was when she was just a young woman. She dressed up as a flapper girl and went to a party with some of her friends. Martha's costume was complete with a fringed dress, a headband, and a feather boa. She looked absolutely stunning and was the hit of the party.

In the years that followed, Martha's Halloween costumes only got more elaborate and creative. One year, she dressed up as a Native American brave and went to a costume party at the Plaza Hotel. Martha's costume was complete with a headdress made out of feathers and a buckskin outfit. She looked like she was straight out of a history book.

In the 1980s, Martha's Halloween costumes became more sophisticated and elegant. She dressed up as a Hollywood starlet and went to a party in New York City. Martha's costume was complete with a vintage dress, a hat, and a pair of ruby red slippers. She looked like she was straight out of the 1950s.

As Martha's career and personal life evolved, so did her Halloween costumes. In the 1990s, she dressed up as a judge and went to a costume party in Aspen, Colorado. Martha's costume was complete with a black robe, a wig, and a gavel. She looked like she was straight out of a TV courtroom.

In the 2000s, Martha's Halloween costumes became more playful and whimsical. She dressed up as a witch and went to a party in New York City. Martha's costume was complete with a pointed hat, a broom, and a cauldron of bubbling potion. She looked like she was straight out of a children's book.

As Martha's career and personal life continued to evolve, so did her Halloween costumes. In the 2010s, she dressed up as a farmer and went to a costume party in upstate New York. Martha's costume was complete with a straw hat, overalls, and a pitchfork. She looked like she was straight out of a classic Americana painting.

In conclusion, Martha's Halloween costumes have always been a source of inspiration and creativity. From her early days as a young woman to her current status as a media mogul, Martha has always had a unique and eye-catching costume to wear. Whether she was dressed up as a flapper girl, a Native American brave, or a witch, Martha's costumes were always the hit of the party. Happy Halloween, Martha!

title: An Analysis of Trump Supporters Has Identified 5 Key Traits
body_text:
In a recent study, researchers have analyzed the characteristics of individuals who support President Donald Trump and identified five key traits that distinguish them from those who do not.

The first trait is a strong sense of nationalism and a belief in the superiority of the American people. These individuals tend to view the world through a lens of patriotism and see themselves as protectors of the country.

The second trait is a tendency to trust in authority figures and a belief in the importance of following orders. These individuals often view themselves as part of a larger group and believe that their leaders have the best intentions for the country.

The third trait is a belief in the importance of traditional values and a desire to maintain the status quo. These individuals tend to be resistant to change and view any attempts to challenge the established order with suspicion.

The fourth trait is a tendency to view the world in black and white terms, with a lack of nuance and complexity. These individuals tend to simplify complex issues and view the world as a battle between good and evil.

The fifth and final trait is a belief in conspiracy theories and a willingness to trust in sources that support their beliefs. These individuals often view the world as a dangerous and unpredictable place, and are willing to believe the worst about those who they perceive as threats to their way of life.

Researchers believe that understanding these five key traits can help us better understand the motivations and beliefs of those who support President Trump, and potentially inform our interactions with them in the future.

American Horror Story is a television series that never fails to deliver spine-chilling moments and terrifying visuals. Gallagher also discussed the importance of color in the show's posters. He explained that the use of bold, bright colors can be used to convey a sense of danger and excitement, while the use of muted, subdued colors can be used to convey a sense of foreboding and dread. For example, the poster for season one of American Horror Story features a striking image of a woman's face with bright red lips, while the poster for season eight features a haunting image of a child's hand reaching out from a pool of blood.

Overall, Gallagher's insights into the thought process behind creating American Horror Story's terrifying posters offer a glimpse into the show's unique approach to horror.
